name: Apple Pork Chops and Stuffing
author: Sweetly
summary: Tender, moist pork chops surrounded by apples and stuffing make this quick and easy supper a great meal anytime.
ingredients: 1 (21 ounce) can apple pie filling with cinnamon
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; brown pork chops in the hot oil, 3 to 4 minutes per side
Bring water and margarine to a boil in a saucepan; add stuffing mix and cover
Remove saucepan from heat and let stand 5 minutes to absorb water
Remove cover and fluff stuffing with a fork
Spread apple pie filling into the prepared baking dish; layer pork chops onto pie filling layer
Cover baking dish with aluminum foil
Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes
Remove aluminum foil and cook until pork is no longer pink in the center, about 10 more minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
